**Thank you for supporting the manifesto!**

**Privacy note**: Issues are public. Use "Anonymous" or a pseudonym for privacy. Do **not** include specific company/vendor names in red flag stories, keep them generic.

For full instructions, see [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/I-Know-My-Own-LLM/iknowmyownllm_manifesto/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### What are you submitting? (check all that apply)
- [ ] Signature for the manifesto
- [ ] Red flagged story for the Hall of Amusing Red Flags
---

## Section 1: Signature Details *(fill only if submitting a signature)*

**Name** *(required)*
Your real name, a pseudonym, or "Anonymous"
> Anonymous

**Title** *(optional)*
Professional title (e.g., Security Researcher). Leave empty for more anonymity.
>

**Comment / Testimonial** *(optional)*
A short statement of support or reason for signing.
>

**Email** *(optional)*
For verification purposes only — will NOT be displayed publicly. If left empty, your GitHub username will be used for attribution.
>

---

## Section 2: Hall of Amusing Red Flags *(fill only if submitting a red flag)*

**Generic Pattern Description**
Describe the pattern generically — NO specific company or vendor names! Feel free to suggest colors and emojis for presentation.
>

**Why is this concerning?**
Explain the risk or red-flag logic.
>

**Verification Methods**
How did you identify or verify this pattern?
>

---

## Checklist

- [ ] SIGNATURE - I have read and agree with the manifesto principles.
- [ ] SIGNATURE - I consent to my signature being publicly displayed on the manifesto site.
- [ ] REDFLAG - My red flag story is based on real experiences (not fabricated).
- [ ] REDFLAG - I don't directly name companies or individuals.

---

The maintainers will review your submission and add approved signatures to `public/signatures.csv` and approved red flags to the Hall (anonymized/generic as needed).

Thank you for helping build a more trustworthy AI ecosystem!
